text: 2017 release, on tap. Aroma is very floral, I got bourbon right after the pour but it seems to have dissipated greatly after sitting in the glass. Brilliantly clear, nice bright yellow color. None of the ingredients really steal the show on the tongue, its fairly balanced in that regard, but the flavors seem very subdued. It is a bit watery, and seemingly dryer than my memory of previous versions. More acidic than expected as well. Also, theres a bit of astringency coming through, likely from the pecans im guessing. Would like to see the next batch a touch sweeter, and with more flavor contribution from the nuts and spices.

December 22, 2016. Bottle. 
Clear golden with some small quickly dissipating bubbles. Aroma is sweet and spicy with floral honey notes, hints of maple syrup, vanilla, cinnamon, banana, nutmeg and a touchen of bourbon. Taste is sweet, fruity and spicy. Medium bodied, oily texture, very light carbonation. Finish is sweet, floral, light oak with a tannic hint, some spices.
A: Light yellow coloured N: Honey, medicine, banana, floral, perfume, vanilla T: Banana, floral honey, vanilla O: Light carbonated... A bit chemical flavours to it. Decent.

Bottle from a trade from a while ago. Definitely not still as label indicates. Moderate carbonation. Light cinnamon spicing and modest bourbon barrel character. No banana or maple character. Good. It past its prime.

This smells like one of the best sweet breakfasts youve ever had. The taste is a little prickly. I wanted it more syrupy to go on with the syrup aroma. Flavor is light compared to smell it best I can remember having from Kuhnhenn yet.

07.10.2016, 6 oz bottle (2012 vintage) @ BBGTC vintage mead tasting:
No head, light golden color. Aroma is almond pudding, almond essence, medicine, burnt caramel, toast. Taste is slightly dry and harsh mineraly, almond essence, almond pudding, minerals, toast, burnt caramel, honey, medicine. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh medical mouthfeel. Probably faded a lot. Not all bad, there are something nice in it as well.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares ft. Aaron from Oregon 5.0. Pours pale yellow with no head. Aroma of CINNAMOOOOOOON, cinnamon rolls, maple, maybe a tiny hint of the banana, weak butter, some honey, butterscotch, toasted malts, cardamom and some honey. The taste has CINNAMOOOOOON, some honey, weak spices in general, toffee, maple, some bitter nuts and a weak acidic note as well. Interesting and nice mead!

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares ft. Aaron from Oregon 5.0. Pours clear yellow. Aromas of cinnamon, vanilla, toast, nutty, sweet fruity notes, honey. Taste is cinnamon, vanilla, cakey, subtle artificial cleaning product note, nutty, sweet fruity, honey.
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare feat. Aaron from Oregon 5.0. Clear bronze pour, flat. Tons of spices here, cinnamon, maple, light ginger, grains, pancakes and some syrup. Gewd!

(12oz bottle) clear very light yellow, excellent lacing. Nose of wildflower, honey, banana, spices, French toast, light bourbon. Taste is equally complex, banana, touch of bourbon, medium sweet, no heat at all despite the 16%, winter spices, quick palate finish but delicious and complex.
Tasted during beer trip through Florida. Only numerical ratings were recorded during this trip.
Bottle thanks to Russell. Pours a clear gold with no head. The aroma is caramelized banana, sweet cinnamon, nutmeg. Thin mouth, honey, nutmeg, banana, boozy, very nice.

Bottle shared, 2012 vintage. Pours clear golden with a few bubbles that disappear quickly. Aroma of spice upfront, Christmas spices, cinnamon, hazelnut coming out, honey, floral notes, light perfume, banana, oak, toffee and vanilla. Flavour is light heavy sweet. Warming in the palate and the finish, you can tell the alcohol is there but its not in a nasty way. It comes across slightly watery in the start but quickly develops into a heavy spice and long sweet middle/finish with some raisin and overripe dark fruit aspects coming out. On of the most complex meads Ive tried.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Almost no head. Clear golden pour. Clear barrel notes in the aroma and taste. Very good

Un 2 onces dans une petite tulipe. Une robe de vin blanc. Des bulles au versement. Un nez floral avec de la cannelle, de la vanille et du bourbon poivré, des fruits et du bois. Un goût dépices et de bourbon avec du miel et une douceur fruitée qui méchappe. Au palais, un corps huileux avec une effervescence fine. En finale, un alcool parfumé un peu chaud et piquant. Bizarre mais bien agréable.

Sample. [2015]
Pours clear greenish yellow with no head. Some legs. Aroma is of perfume, flowers, alcohol, medical syrup. Taste is of perfume, strong alcohol, flowers, weird nuts, blood, rotten fruits and fat. Palate: Full bodied. No carbonation. Sticky. Warming alcohol. Overall: Oh boy. Quite cloying. Almost undrinkable. Too bold, very boozy. Medical syrup-like. Drain pour.

How: Sample (2 oz) from bottle (375 ml) at home. 2015 vintage. Sent by Matt, thanks! 

>>> Disappointing mead considering the sky high ratings. Interesting French Toast aroma, but something was clearly wrong with the taste (acidic) / palate (carbonated). 

+  Aroma is enticing (though its borderline artificial) with cinnammon, nutmeg, vanilla, bourbon, banana and alcohol all expressing them in a rather cohesive "bouquet"
+  The alcohol warmth in the finish is well dosed, enough to tone down the flavors and not enough to burn 
−  The color (coconut water - yellow) and the haziness arent so pretty 
−  Theres a tiny bit of carbonation (quickly gone) that isnt meant to be there and definitely hinders the depth and the sweetness impression of this one 
−  Theres a weird acidity in the taste 

Flavors:  Bourbon, hazelnuts, bananas, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla, toffee/maple syrup

Still mead, 2012 bottle. Crystal clear pale yellow pour. Bottle all to myself! Amazing nose on this. Right up there with my most memorable aroma experiences: New Glarus Very Sour Blackberry and Goose Island 2013 Proprietors. Honey quickly moves to cinnamon and vanilla with bourbon and banana on the back end. Taste is really nice as well, but damn, that nose is something to experience.

Sample from Tom10101, thanks man! The cap came off with some carbonation, and there was a little bit in the glass as well so I let it sit a little while to tone down. Appearance is much like a white wine, light golden, not much else to see. Aroma is chalk full of vanilla, oak, honey, and some stingy booze, very nice though. Taste is honey, oak, light sourness, with a dry boozy finish. Ill be honest, I dont get much in the way of french toast or maple, I get lots of honey, oak, and a hint of odd sourness. Not bad, but not mind numbing either.

Pours a clear light golden with some legs. Nose is of alcohol, honey and light spices. Taste is pretty hot and lightly sweet, offers cinnamon, butter and light bourbon. Body is light to medium and mouthfeel a little sticky but all the alcohol is a bit rough. Some definite french toast impressions in the finish. Overall I thought it was OK but a definite letdown in comparison to what the hype would suggest. Just too boozy.

2 oz sample. Clear very pale yellow pour. Aroma is quite boozy, lots of vanilla, tons of bourbon, very aromatic but not very discernable french toast. Taste is sweet, lots of bourbon, vanilla, some french toast flavor, honey, malt extract, very sweet and boozy, lots of borubon. Palate is med full bodied and slick. Not bad, getting close to the intended flavor profile but overly sweet, thin and artificial for my liking.

sample. hazy very light yellow pour with some decent legs sticking. mint, eucalyptus, vanilla, lilac, astringent booze, strong honey character - buckwheat reminiscence; banana and coconut-scented solar cream; other miscellaneous (and misplaced) spices, orange blossom water. not quite flat carbonation (!), medium body; aromatic and fragrant bitter herbs leaving an herbal/medicinal finish. complex by its additions and treatment. nah.
Bottle. Light barely yellow pour, flat. Sweet French toast, and vanilla aromas. Flavors are sweet French toast, cinnamon, vanilla and oak.

Thanks Brian for sharing the 2015 version of this.

A - Very faint light yellow. a little bit of carbonation on the headsuper faint.

S - Bourbon and cinnamon dominate the aroma. You smell booze.

T - The taste is incredibly complex. I didnt think all of that flavor could be in one bottle. Maple, cinnamon sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, doughy malt and vanilla, bourbon, whiskeytheres just so much in here. 

M - Not too thick, the sweetness comes in the middle and lingers for a very long time.

O - This is a very interesting mead. Sweet but not cloying, could drink an entire bottle of this stuff!

UPDATED: APR 7, 2016 Brians Grand Mead tasting. Thanks for this Willrunforbeer! Clear pale yellow. Aroma is off the damn chain. Banana foster, cinnamon, bread and a dough like character. I never thought they could really get a "French Toast" nuance.. Im surprised! 
Flavor is just like the aroma and I am besides myself with the flavor profile. Mouthfeel is fuller with the bready/ dough body giving a fuller mouthfeel. Maple syrupy like feelings. The cinnamon and banana is crazy. I am a pretty hard person to impress at this point in my Mead/beer/ cider tasting. This is insanely good and have so much flavor I dont even taste any honey. Really something different, well done!
Had to adjust because of how unique it is.

375mL from trade. So excited to finally try this! Pours pale white gold, just a few tiny white bubbles, no legs. Aroma is banana, maple, bourbon. Flavor is banana, maple, cinnamon, bourbon. Does taste like a banana French toast with bourbon barrel aged maple syrup. Theres a little bit of carbonation that Im not sure is intended. Alcohol fairly well hidden. Neat.
Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer. Pours clear pale golden with no head. Aromas of honey apple maple and bourbon. Taste is sweet and follows aroma with more apple. Quite a nice treat.

Bottle, 2014 with thanks to fishmich! Pours clear pale golden, no head, no lacing. Aroma is honey, bourbon, apple, maple. Flavor is fairly sweet, lots of apple for some reason, honey, bourbon, some maple, but not a lot. I can see bananas, but only cause the description tells me they are there. Lots of apple. Why apple? Medium body, smooth, ABV (14% for this vintage) is very well hidden. Tasty.

Aroma: Bourbon, Banana, Mild Rum

Appearance: Clear Golden Straw Hue, Passes Lots of Light, No Head, No Lacing

Taste: Bananas, Syrup, Bourbon

Mouthfeel: No Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Drying, Mildly Boozy

Pours a very clear whitish-yellow. Aroma is honey and lots of spices, such as cinnamon and maybe nutmeg. that is reminiscent of good french toast, along with a touch of bourbon. Flavor is sweet honey, nut, and spices. This is just incredible. The blend of spices and sweetness is spot-on. There is no hint of booze, and the mead goes down nice and smooth. Its too bad this is so rare and pricey.

375 ml bottle at home. Pours clear light golden, no head, no carbo. The nose is an utter and unique bouquet making one think of some sturdy European sweet dishes: apfelstrudel, speculoos and een goei snee kramiek me een dikke plak goeie boereboter deroep aka raisin bread with the thickest of butters. Two aromas lead the dance: cinnamon and thick honey, supported by a buttery flowery scent, a tad of alccohol in the nose, the wine touch makes one think of glühwein as well (the reference is interesting, but glühwein is crap), etc. One of the most beautiful bouquets ever found in a mead (although I havent tasted a lot of m yet). Medium body, high sweetness, high on the ethanol side as well makes one think of a warm winter warmer. Taste is pear, white wine, apricots and cinnamon let it be in smaller doses than in the nose. Magnificent!
Pours a still golden; aroma is a phenomenal blend of banana, maple, and bourbon. Taste is true to the aroma, but better. Thrilled I got even a small sample to taste.
Smell is intense french toast. No carbonation with very light bit of alcohol warmth and taste that lingers. Taste is french toast, almonds and other assorted nuts, and a slight bit of banana.

Nice to finally track down this whale! Thanks to arminjewell I think. It pours a clear light gold color. The aroma is surprisingly floral with some high alcohols, heavy hazelnut, banana, vanilla and caramel syrup. The flavor has alcohol, hazelnut and banana. Very light yet oily on the palate with a bright floral quality to the alcohol. Drinkable with a distinct spirits-like feel in the mouth. Ultra unique and unlike anything else Ive had. Im not a Mead expert by any means, but this was not what I expected. Very interesting and tasty on some levels, but another one I cant really drink too much of.

Sampled at 2011 RBWG. Bottle by Dasilky1. Pours clear yellow with no head. The nose is and taste is fantastic! Vanilla, melted butter, cinnamon, almond oil, banana and bourbon. Oily still mouthfeel. WOW!

Huge thanks to Vinny for making this possible. Poured into a Hill Farmstead snifter. Pours a still, clear golden body revealing a thick coating as the glass tilts from side to side. Aroma is ridiculous: at first it starts out with a rich toasted honey flavor, but as the mead warms, the banana and vanilla flavors really come out; coupled with the toasted character and you get an insanely rich, french toast-like nose. Mouthfeel is rich but not as rich as the aroma lets on to be - essentially tastes like a really nice, quality honey mead. I keep going back to just inhaling the nose as it continues to open with flavors of cinnamon, rich pastry, melted banana pie, vanilla, maple and spices. I swear you can almost get an almost toasted bread-y, egg-badder character singular to that breakfast/brunch platter of french toast. Truly a wonderful liquid, thanks again Vin.

Rated on 7-24-2010 at the Ratebeer Summer Gathering in Grand Rapids, MI. This bottled mead has a transparent golden body. The aroma is sweet, banana bread, honey, and vanilla. The taste is sweet, honey, banana bread, vanilla, and alcohol. The palate is tingly and this mead is medium bodied. Overall, this is one heck of a great tasting mead! The flavors come together extremely well, smells like banana bread, worth trying and definitely a mead that I will drink again if it comes my way! Nicely done, Kuhnhenn!

In short: A very toasted mead with unique flavors that defies categories.
How: Bottle shared by my man Kyle at post HF FoFA 2013 party.
The look: Clear yellow body with no head (looks like a mead which means looks like a white wine).
In long: The strong nose is unique and hard to describe. It is toasted honey (if such a thing even existed), hazelnuts, dried banana peels, toasted pastry. Ive never smelled a mead so toasted and it is quite inviting. In mouth it is a mead, it is very thick but maybe a little less sticky-syrupy than typical meads. Taste is very unique. Maybe Im easily manipulated by drink names, but I swear I tasted french toasts, freshly pan-fried french toasts, unreal. Also vanilla, hazelnuts, toasted waffles, toasted bananas, only mild spicy notes. Surprisingly not a strong honey flavor in this mead. Finish is somewhat toasty dry (yes, a 15%-ish mead with a dry finish!!!). My first Wow mead, this one deserves the hype, very unique and immensely enjoyable. So Im gonna go on and say like everybody else and say this mead is awesome, but Im easily manipulated, after I wash my pants with my new detergent I think they smell Fresh Tidal Wave.

12 oz bottle. 2012 Vintage. Shared in line at the 4 Elf Party. Whoa man. This is just incredible! It smells like a plate of French toast. There is a lovely bready, mapley, syrupy, cinnamon aroma to this thing. Its got hints of banana, and a beautiful nuttiness. The cinnamon is what seems to dominate as cinnamon tends to do. The flavor is much of the same. Aside from it being a cold liquid, one could be fooled into thinking they had just enjoyed a delightful stack of French toast. I wish the cinnamon wasnt so dominant, but its hard to work with... And, the 14.5% alcohol is completely undetectable. This is just incredible!

Pour out of 330 mL bottle, huge thanks to Travis for the pour! Clear orange pour with no head, aroma brought notes of big notes of honey, cinnamon toast crunch, big vanilla, oak, slight bourbon that adds mostly more vanilla, graham cracker in there, this smells fantastic. Taste is spicy, cinnamon, ginger, hints of honey, slight earth into big vanilla, cinnamon cereal, hints of graham cracker, finishing sweet, spicy. Very, very nice.

Poured a clear to light yellow color from the bottle with huge aromas of cinnamon, bread, bananas, sweetness, and a twinge of bourbon. Flavors were amazing, a mixture of cinnamon, bananas, bourbon, and a light aftertaste of eggs. Maybe it was my mind playing tricks, but I swear I tasted eggs.... Anyways I never wanted the bottle to end and when it did, I was quite sad, glad I got to finally drink this mead, another solid, scratch that another amazing mead that everyone should try. Kudos to Kuhnhenn for making this mead that I NEED more of.

2012 bottle to oversized wine glass. 14.5% ABV edition. I dont rate many beers/meads, but after one sip, I logged on to rate this. Sort of a commemoration, so to speak. Its a still mead so no head or movement as it sits in the glass. Chardonnay wine color. Nutty aroma: hazelnut, almond, and pistachio. Spices are there, too. I detect mostly cinnamon and nutmeg, but there could be several others. Taste is absolutely amazing. Nutty, spicy, and definitely French toast. Best mead I have had. A little orange zest flavor pokes through upon further inspection. Definintely getting a lot of hazelnuts or almonds. Reminds me of Frangelico liqueur. Not as syrupy as expected and finishes surprisingly dry. A real beauty. Worth taking the time to rate!

Huge thanks to Brad at Jackie Os for sharing this one in honor of Rachaels birthday. Clear yellow in color with no head and some legs. Aroma of cinnamon, maple, almond, bread, egg and slight banana. Bread and cinnamon flavor with almond and egg before a semi-sweet maple and banana finish. Truly outstanding.
The flavor and aroma are ripe with spicy cinnamon, smooth sweet maple syrup, and fresh bananas

375ml bottle. No idea what to expect but just knew I wanted to try it. No carbonation when the cap comes off, completely clear with just a slight yellow tinge. Maraschino cherries, some nutmeg, vanilla, almond extract, hazelnuts, some oak, honey and alcohol. No carbonation, moderate+ body, sweet, becomes incredibly dry, reminds me of vanilla wafers but with booze. Very happy I got to try this - worth seeking out for sure.

2012 Vintage
Tasted on 8/31/13 from a capped 375mL bottle, big thanks to JR for bringing this one. Pours clear pale yellow with no head, much like a white wine. The nose is absolutely fantastic. It smells just like fresh-off-the-griddle french toast with plenty of cinnamon and all of the beautiful caramel and maple bourbon in the background. There is a bit of heat on the nose and just a touch of hazelnut coming through. On the palate, it is almost the same with just the right amount of sweetness, a ton of french toast and the bourbon nuttiness on the back of the palate. The body is full with no carbonation and a long finish featuring the bourbon and hazelnut.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2015 Smells like french toast. No seriously, it does. Toasty bread, sugary, honey, heavy cinnamon, light banana sweetness, some syrupy maple and a touch of cocoa powder. Complex, lots of stuff going on. Very sweet, booze is hidden very well. Would be better if the cinnamon were toned down just a bit and the french toast flavors were allowed to shine a bit more. Still, very tasty stuff.
Nutmeg, bourbon banana, and more bourbon. Flavors if every breakfast spice available. Long legs and huge aromas of banana and vanilla. Amazingly well done.

Traded for a bottle with a buddy in Chicago. This is the 2012 bottling poured into a fantome tulip. Pours a dull yellow color with a few bubbles along the edge of the glasses. Nose is heavenly, I can pick out the cinnamon, maple syrup, doughiness of the French toast, and some underlying vanilla bean. It is basically perfect. I get a lot of similar themes that I get in the nose, but a little less pronounced. There is also a little sourness on the front end that Im not sure I understand. I didnt taste this when I previously had it, but my palate just may be a little shot. Mouthfeel is lighter and a little syrupy, with no carbonation, and a moderate finish. Very good mead, but Ive heard from multiple people that this pales in comparison to previous batches.

Bottle shared by my good bud Ed Roberts, thanks bud! Never really been a mead type of guy but this was incredible. Nice spicy cinnamon aroma with no real heat to speak of. Definitely taste very similar to french toast. Ill be on the look out for more of these for sure

Bottle shared by badnewsbeers. Slightly hazy straw body, no head. Dense, rich, nay decadent nose with caramel, butterscotch, rum, and butter syrup; sweet and a tad burnt. Sweet, sharp body with brown sugar, syrup, caramel, and doughy toast. Not one to guzzle down, but a slow, rewarding sipper that would go great with breakfast. Very nice.

Tasting courtesy of dschiller. Bottle says Bourbon Barrel Banana French Toast Mead, didnt see that available, posting the rating here. Pours a lovely gold color and it coats the glass with a nice glaze. Aromas are butter, banana, cinnamon, bread, toast, nuts, raisins, and maple. Flavors are butter, nuts, toast, maple, banana and something that is more a cream-type flavor. Palate this is super thick and heavy but not overpowering in any way. Overall, this is one of the best drinking experiences I have ever had, tastes just advertised like a great plate of banana french toast; absolutely fantastic!

Bottle many thanks too ICEatALAMO.  Pours a crystal clear pale yellow, with no head.  Amazing it smells like french toast and maraschino cherries.  Banana, vanilla, cinnamon, super sweet french toast, maple syrup, bourbon, maraschino cherries, and honey.  Reminiscent of the cereal French Toast Crunch.  Tasty and interesting, very glad to have tried it.

Bottle @ Crooked Stave ROY-G-BIV Day. Huge thanks to Travis from CS for sharing this one with some of us. WOW! This mead smells stupid good. So hard to explain except that it literally smells like Cinnamon French Toast - bourbon maple syrup, cinnamon, somewhat nutty, buttery, butterscotch, coconut, and nice spice. Taste is mouth-watering - super sweet, cinnamon, bourbon french toast pancakes - vanilla, butterscotch, and sweet caramel syrup. Light body with soft carbonation. This one is totally worth the hype!

Bottle @ Crooked Stave ROY-G-BIV Day, big fucking thanks to Travis for sharing this with Armin, Stephen, and I. Pour a golden appearance with a bit of a bubbly white head. Aroma is out of this fucking world- bananas, nuts, toffee, honey, and caramel. Fairly nutty, somewhat herbal, moderate bourbon, toffee/caramel flavor with a nice banana presence. Man, I really would love to try this again. Fucken a bro.

375 ml bottle shared by jckp64- thanks again, John! I think it was a 2012 bottle. Darker green glass; Ive seen small clearer ones. Pours a pale, clear golden color with no head or carbonation. Pretty accurate description- smells and tastes like french toast. Brown sugar, cinnamon, honey, maple; the flavor has more spice and apple to the noses multi-dimensional sweetness. Banana and hazelnut arent as big as other notes, though. Medium-bodied, with a smooth, warming palate and no carbonation. Really interesting.
Incredible smell to this one, smells exactly as advertised. The flavor is a barrage of booze and cinnamon spice,

Pours clear deep golden with no head. The aroma is perfect, big sweet hazelnuts that smell like maraschino cherries and French Toast with maples syrup, just as intended and ridiculous! The flavor starts out sweet with honey at first, but then gets huge with influence of the bourbon, not spicy or vanilla, but smooth sweet liqueur. The bananas are lightly in the background, but overall the flavors are blended so well.

2012 bottle, label says 14.5% abv.  Finally getting to try this, had a really bad day so I need a pick-me-up.  Pours a light yellow color, still.  Weird, I smelled bourbon when pouring into the snifter but now all I get is french toast.  Amazing, butter, nuts, bananas, cinnamon, and vanilla.  Bourbon is definitely there on the first sip, right up front along with sweet honey.  French toast flavor is in the finish.  All of aromas blend together in the finish with some maple syrup too.  Moderate sweetness throughout.  Slight warming finish, light booziness.  I really wasnt sure if I was gonna like this but its pretty great.  Very unusual.  The french toast flavor stays with you a very long time.  I gotta say though, I think I might actually like this better without the bourbon aging.

Bottle shared @ Oakquinox 2013. Clear pale yellow pour with a no carbonation. Huge cinnamon, banana, honey, and maple syrup aromas. Nice bourbon, honey, and very light hazelnut. The flavor is incredibly sweet and reminiscent of bourbon maple syrup. Nice spice notes of cinnamon, some hazelnut, honey, banana, and tons of vanilla.

Via trade with Gunson.  The aroma is intriguing, like bready, hazelnuts, banana, maple syrup, cinnamon.  It smells vaguely like french toast.   Some boozy aromas, but hardly overpowering.  The appearance is clear gold, like apple juice, a thin white head which vanishes quickly.  The flavor is honey, some bourbon, bananas, sweeter and more boozy than the aroma, but less complex.  The finish is sweet, honey, followed with a bourbon burn.  Pretty thin in body.  Unusual beverage, but enjoyable.

This one poured a still golden yellow with just very slight bubbles from the poured.  Aroma was boom in your face of honey, booze, maple and bananas.  Flavor was sticky sweet but not over the top, light vanilla cake batter, honey, dough, bananas, maple, and butter but not in a diacetyl way. Definitely my favorite mead, but a bit disappointing given some of the descriptions ive read before.

lightly hazed golden straw body with thick sheet legs.  it does have a very powerful aroma that is close to french toast and sugared waffles and almond pastries (something about the waffle breakfast cereal from my childhood), but the nose is both musty (yeasty and dirty) and the honey expression seems to offset the maple syrup, banana, nuts and spices enough. sweet taste, medium-high body, medium acid, some hot alcohols and some light harshness in the finish.  a fun mead with a lot going on but not all of it working in balance.  the oak seems to have dirtied the nose a bit and the bananas arent noticeable through the haze of nuts, spices, oak and maple syrup.  not bad, and I would probably enjoy it more on its own, but against a lot of cleaner meads these flaws are pretty evident.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2013 Bottle shared by Alan with Bill, Frank and Alan. Pours a clearish gold with no lacing. Aroma is egg badder french toast, cinnamon, banana, maple syrup, earthy honey. Flavor is cinnamon toast crunch, buttery wood, lemons, banana bread, grapefruit rind, honey and brown sugar. So awesome as it warmed. Wow.

Bottle shared with Greg, tnx man. Pours beutiful darkish yellow . Aroma is intense almonds marzipan sweet bananas. Flavor so sweet balanced almonds barrel some vanilla bananas. Good lonnglived sweet almondy finish.

This bottled brew from rbsg #30 poured no head at all.  It had a uncarbonated transparent light yellow orange colored body. The mild bourbon aroma was sweet and like nail polish. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a bubbly aftertaste. Rhe flavor contained notes of sweet hops and burns as it goes down. Delicious and one I would certainly like to have again.

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle:  The aroma consists of banana, vanilla, butter, syrup, and light alcohol.  One of the best smelling "beers" Ive had in a long time.  It pours a transparent gold with a few bubbles that eventually fade leaving the liquid look still.  A swirl leaves some sticky legs on the sides of the glass.  The flavor starts with moderate banana, vanilla, and the slightest hint of apple.  The finish has maple syrup, a touch of butter, and alcohol.  Its medium bodied with minimal carbonation.  Overall, its crazy how they got the butter flavor in there to actually make it taste like French toast.

Bottle shared by BenC...thanks Ben! - Pours light amber with no head. Nose is amaretto, cinnamon toast and a bit of maple sweetness. Taste is honey, cinnamon, amaretto, vanilla, and a eggy breadiness that is uncannily like french toast. Light bodied with no carbonation. Angels didnt come out of the sky with trumpets blaring, but it was good stuff.

Thanks to IBrew2or3 for this one.  Cheers, Dave!! Pours a clear yellow-gold with no head- its a mead.  Nose is bourbon, powdered sugar, huge vanilla, mild booze, and some light earthy honey.  Flavor is a tremendous blend of sugar, some cinnamon, some light sugar, and some bourbon and vanilla.  Light in body, mildly boozy, and really cool.

Shared with Thomas, 2012 8 oz bottle poured into Upland stemware.  You cant be more on point with the scent of french toast as these guys.  One of the best smelling liquids ever, i guess that is if your into NYC brunch.....

Taste was sugary sweet with a slight maple syrup and carmelized bananana.  This was actually my first mead experience, hopefully its not all down hill from here as this was exceptional.  Still has not swayed me for my love of sours, as the sweetness was slightly more than i could stomach if drinking more than 4oz.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2013 2012, thanks Joel. One whiff and...holy moly, this is incredible! Immersive French toast aroma. I can smell the butter, toasted bread, and the powdered sugar on top. Geez. Get me a scented candle of this ASAP.

Sweet honey on the palate gives way to bananas and vanilla. Banana really shines towards the end, and I swear theres maple syrup in the aftertaste as it descends. Cinnamon clings to the back of my throat. Mildly boozy. In a word? Transcendent. Need moar!

Holy schnikeys. A massive thanks to Mark for bringing this. Aroma = just what it says on the bottle. Tons of bourbon and, yes, french toast. I dont know how they did this but it is out of this world. Vanilla, bourbon, light banana aroma with that french toast follow up. Pour is yellow with some bubbles. You know, its a mead. Flavor is spot on. Bourbon, vanilla, banana, cinnamon, some french toast, and not boozey for that 16%. This is incredible.

(Bottle) Pours pale gold with no head. The aroma holds boatloads of almond paste/marzipan, hazelnut, sticky honey, sponge cake, vanilla, light coconut, light cinnamon, mild barrel ageing, melted butter, amaretto, liqueur, praline, and syrup caramelized ripe banana. Not uber complex but mega super yummy. The flavor is light to heavily sweet and tiny acidic with notes of bitter almonds, honey, vanilla, cinnamon, banana, cake, barrel, liqueur and flowers. The mouthfeel is sticky, round and somewhat fancy with no carbonation. Lingering, candy-like finish. Medium to full bodied.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2012 Bottle received in trade. Thank you Boltz7555! Pours clear golden with no head worth mentioning. Smell is huge and very sweet with ripe banana, cinnamon, marzipan, vanilla fudge, alcohol, toast, caramelized sugar, sweet sweet honey, bourbon, charred wood, coconut, nutmeg and cardamom. Taste is very sweet with ripe banana, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, honey, toast, nutmeg, alcohol, marzipan, banana bread, melted butter, lactose, vanilla fudge, dry wood and bourbon. Mouthfeel is sticky sweet, round, burning boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet with banana bread, vanilla fudge, roasted coconut, alcohol, cinnamon, cardamom, hazelnuts, nutmeg, honey, lactose and melted butter. Its exactly what the name says it is! Great great stuff! Very happy to share this with a friend as his 1000th US rating.

Bottle thanks to _angst_. Pale yellow no head. Cinnamon aroma, spicy, banana, French toast, bread, floral notes. Cinnamon flavor, caramel, hometown, bread, floral notes, raisins, hay, some spicy notes.

This is the best mead ever created. Taste, smell, and mouthfeel are top notch. Bananas, French toast, syrup, vanilla, honey. Absolutely stunning in every way. This mead is top notch. Top notch. Smooth bourbon flavor too. Wish it was seasonal or year round instead of randomly produced. Thanks Adam.

Bottle @ French Oktoberfest Tasting Ulfborg, 2012. Pours clear no color. Banana, bread, cookies, vanilla and butter. Extremely sweet and just as weird. But even more weird its enjoyable and quite exciting. A different experience.

gylden klar skum ingen 
vanilje bannan honing is dessert 
bitter lidt sød meget 
flad let til medium flad 
@f1 19710-12
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear golden without head. Aroma is sweet honey, caramel, banana, vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is very sweet. Very sweet finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 191012
Bottle @ FoneFan. Clear golden with no head. Aroma is honey, banana bread and bourbon. Flavour is honey, banana bread, bourbon, little perfume, fruit and wood.

Bottle 180ml. clear glass @ [ Hotel tasting @ Hotel Tulip - Bodegraven ] after 4th Borefts Beer Festival 2012.[ Courtesy of Secret Summer Santa ]. Clear medium yellow colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy toasted bread, bread, sweet banana, riped banan, barbequed - warm banana, honey, almond, in other words aroma is sweet banana on a buttery toast. Flavour is heavy sweet with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily - syrup, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. The name is fun but the flavors is also very funny - and it made me quit excided :-) So big thanks santa *<:o) [20120929]

Thanks Craig for sharing this. Pours a blonde colour with an amazing aroma of eggs, custard, vanilla, buttered popcorn, coconut, banana, sultanas, caramel and creme brulee. Similar flavours again with a brandy like alcoholic warmth. This reminds me of a weirdly delicious jelly belly combination, maybe banana, buttered popcorn and coconut?

Bottle via a trade. 2012. Pours with a vibrant and clear golden hued body with amazing, laser etched legs. Aromas are bready, banana, maple syrup, bourbon, amaretto, lightly peachy, biscuity, vanilla. Absolutely intoxicating aroma. Flavors are absolutely intense and mind blowing. Huge maple, bready, bourbon, coconut, honey, spice, fenugreek, banana, nutmeg and cinnamon. Very biscuity, almost oddly malty. Low vinous, huge barrel. Absolutely an insane beverage!!! Light ester, very well hidden alcohol. Medium viscosity (lower than expected), also much less warming than expected. Lived up to and surpassed my wildest expectations!

Bottle in Fonefan room Borefts 4.  clear gold. No head. Toffee banana and toast aroma. Bit of sultanas. Banoffee pie. Its totally wonderful. Bit hot. Just incredible. Thanks to fonefan so much. Mead comes through.

bottle at de molen after show party ... golden amber ... wierd as fuchy ... egggy french toast .... touch of custard and banana... soft sultana nose ... its f.....n wierd but increadible .... but im not sure i like it .... sweeet honey ... big banana .... honey ... touch of custard ... but boy am i excided by this

Big thanks to my sister 15_to_Kuhnhenn for sending me this. I owe you. It pours clear gold with some nice legginess. The aroma goes nuts as it goes from super smooth sweetness to vanilla to a sliver of banana to a toastiness to toasted bread to a dash of maple and then a touch of chemical booze. The taste is smooth goodness with a pleasing toastiness that runs straight toward being roasty as well as rich honey sweetness, a maple syrup like note, a bit of banana and sweet vanilla. Behind all of those notes is a modest level of chemical booze. All these notes go oh so well together. YUM.
bottle at dld 12. Pours clear yellow no head nose butterscotch vanilla licorice maple intense nose flavors of vanilla bourbon butterscotch honey, in the end too cloying to be epic.

(6oz bottle, courtesy of BMan1113VR)  Pours a clear yellow body with excellent legs.  Aroma of banana, honey, maple syrup, and bread.  Flavor of maple, banana, wheat, honey, some amaretto, and liquid egg whites with a dry finish.

A clear light yellow colored beer, with no head. The aroma of bananas, caramel, almond, toast some wood and alcohol. The taste of burny alcohol with fruits like banana and almond and wood notes. The aftertaste is burny, alcohol and sweet.

Sampled at DLD 12 thanks to Jeff.  Smells like fake banana bread. So much sweet dough in the aroma and flavor. Sweet city, its tasting like banana laffy taffy with sugar.  Im also getting a Butter scotch note in there.  Weird stuff (no surprise there) but Ok. 7/3/7/3/13

Nice clear golden pour and wonderful nose that smells like french toast with a little booziness from the bourbon barrels.  The taste is simply like drinking french toast with a hint of bananas.  Love it.
Bottle to snifter (big thanks to hubsluvsbeer). Looks good; like thick champagne. Smells AMAZING! Just like the title suggests. Tastes awesome too! This is WONDERFUL!!!!"

This right here is a mead.  Courtesy of Mikem409.  Aroma is vanilla, apple, cinnamon, honey.  Taste is Bourbon barrel banana french toast mead.... You taste every component and it is showcased perfectly.  What an amazing drink.  WOW
wow, the french toast is strong with this one. Very impressive stuff. The bourbon isnt taking over which is very nice

Much thanks Jeff for sharing this at DorkLordDay 2012, yep I kept the bottle: Beautiful golden hue with minimal head or lace but quite oily. The nose has BIG sweet french toast character of cinnamon, bread and marzipan with some clove and banana coming in and out of play. I found some honey and slight bourbon character as well. Very intoxicating and sinful!  The taste starts with strong honey, vanilla, cinnamon, and bready overtones. A tad flowery and slightly spicy midsection before running off towards a moderately boozy, umani savory finish. Insanely complex, massive sweetness, and everything you would want in a dessert mead. The mouth feel is lush and sticky with a nice warming sensation that did not burn like some meads would. This is just Fing YUMMY, worthy of the hype and it is not often I can say that anymore.

Bottle thanks to Jim.  Pours clear bright yellow color, bubbles here and there.  Aroma is maple syrup, burnt sugars, frech toast (?) - crazy right? I cant really pick out the bananas.  Light barrel notes, but not as much bourbon as I was expecting.  Tates like maple syrup, sugary sweetness, toasted nuts, vanilla, and a little more oak and bourbon here then compared to the nose.  Light body, goes down easy.  This mead is simply amazeballs...Ive never had anything like this, even with all the meads Ive had from Kuhnhenn.  Amazing stuff.

Bottle - Thanks Dave for this wonderful mead. Seriously it smells like banana french toast covered in a bourbon maple syrup and powder sugar. It tastes like it smells but even better with a little more bourbon. This is an amazing mead. Kuhnhenn, this is another awesome mead. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 7oz bottle.  Pours golden in color with absolutely no carbonation.  Aroma hits you like a ton of bricks...it is bananas foster with vanilla and almond.  Taste is INCREDIBLY sweet.  WOW!  Tons of banana, vanilla, almond and sugar.  Crazy good stuff.

Bottle (last beer/mead rated before my 33rd birthday) thanks to FlandersNed. Pours clear gold Nose/taste like a stripper-almond, cinnamon toast, banana, honey, vanilla and bourbon barrel. Perfection. Medium body.
Pours golden and almost wine-like. Aroma is bourbon, honey, cinnamon. And french toast.  Taste is exactly like french toast.  Medium bodied and slick.  Absolutely fantastic.

Simply amazing. Had this at kuhnhenn during st pattys day. I read the reviews before I had it and I didnt understand why people were saying this mead smelled like a stripper but now I understand. The smell is just plain amazing, the palate is thick like ten fidy. The name says it all, Id rather drink this than eat banana French toast, its as if someone poured bourbon flavored syrup on your French toast. Best mead ever.

6.3 oz bottle.  Light golden pour with the expected no head.  The nose on this thing just jumps at you with pecans and bananas.  You also get cinnamon, and sweet honey.  Taste is also a pecan bomb with tons of vanilla, honey, bourbon, cinnamon and other subtle spices.  Super sweet and super delicious.  Could pour this stuff over ice cream.

Pours a clear gold color...bright.  aroma is bourbony with maple syrup, banana, and powdered sugar...maybe a hint of pecan...it smells JUST like the title!  Flavor follows suit!! ...excellent flavors reminiscent of banana french toast with a hint of honey...rediculous!  Mouthfeel is light and the finish tastes of warming maple syrup with a touch of bourbon...im amazed!  Oh and yeah...it tastes like the sexy cheerleaders panties smell.

bottle on st pattys. was so busy drank this right out of the bottle!. smell is of the uber hot cheer leader in highschool you had no chance with. the taste is probably what it would have tasted like if you went down on her.

This is simply the best mead I've ever had. Get a lot of syrup in this one almost butterscotch tasting, and very smooth for 16% abv

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks suzygreenburg!  Muthafn IHOP banana syrup nose combined with coconut and stripper.  I will pay this mead to dance on me.  Pale straw.  Toasty almond and maple syrup, so sweet and oily and hot, its like a candle.  Syrupy sweet and brash.  Concentrated in presence.  Extremely nutty, big maple finish.

Smells like a fucking stripper. No other way to describe it. Tanning oil cocoa butter coconut lotion, perfume. More or less its boner giving. Clear gold yellow pour. Holy fuck this tastes lime a naked hot chick. French toast sweet amazingness. Fucking shit. Best tasting liquor ever. Fucking unbelievable.

Nip. Thanks suzy! Pours clear pale gold. Smells like almond butter, coconut, baby powder, and honey. I would pay this mead $20 for a lap dance. Maybe $40. Sticky but watery body. Honey almond coconut mid palate. Long sticky sweet finish.

pours a still golden color. smell is a blast of sweet vanilla bourbon banana with some almond nuttiness. sweet beeswax rounds it out. taste is a blast of flavors detected in the nose. just a ride through banana french toast flavor town. mouthfeel is super smooth with the sweetness mellowing out the alcohol. overall, wow.

Auction! Absolutely amazing. 

It is so complex yet blended to perfection. I definetly smell and taste, honey, vanilla, nutmeg bananas, candy, bread and caramel. An there is so much more going on. I tip my hat to the brewers.



...

nip at daks 9/5/10. 

clear yellow color.

holy god himself the aroma is amazing! push this thing to eleven!... walnut bread, bruleed banana, honey, burnt caramel, cinnamon, maple covered cooked belgian waffles and florals.

the flavor is not quite as good but still impressive.... hot and starchy. awesome.11/4/8/3/18
@RBWG-thanks to DaSilky1pours a dissipating off white ring for a head and amber color.  Aroma is sweet bourbon, banana.  Taste is bourbon, banana, cinnamon.

Bottled. A hazy yellow mead. The aroma has notes of bananas, wood, and honey. The flavor is very sweet with strong notes of bananas and alcohol, combined with medium note s of toast, eggs, and honey, leading to a dry finish.

18 cl bottle, courtray of Theis. Pours almost clear and golden orange with no lasting head. Aroma is dense vanilla and solid banana fruity. Sticky honey and vanilla mixed with a slight banana note. Sweet and lingering honey herbal finish.
Clear pale piss color. Huge, pungent, fresh baked nutty banana bread aromas. Nutty banana bread flavors with vanilla, mild cinnamon--very good sipper--or maybe pancake syrup
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
Bottle at Theis & Mette.
Clear golden coloured with a small white ehad.
Sweet aroma of caramel and amaretto with notes of bread.
Sweet flavour of caramel, amaretto, bread and bananas with notes of alcohol.
Sweet finish.
Very artificial and dominating aroma and flavour of amaretto and bananas.

enjoyed during 2011 RBWG thanks to DaSilky1 for sharing this, pours light yellow and is still.  Aroma is heavenly, loads of honey and maple syrup notes with banana, walnuts and cinnamon.  Flavor is much the same, sweet banana, maple wood, brown sugar and cinnamon.  Really neat stuff.

Bottle shared by Dasilky1 at RBWG.  Damn, Kuhnhenn makes some amazing meads...will definitely pursue these in the future!!!  As expected, bright honey colored pour with zero head.  One wouldnt expect much from the syrupy, still liquid.  Extremely fragrant with freshly grated cinnamon, split vanilla bean, sliced banana, and brown sugar.  Actually get some nutmeg, maple syrup, and cake batter as well.  Sticky, thick, but oh so divine!!!

Bottle at home - Tasted. Clear yellow/amber - no head. Toasted, banana, toast.... ok. High almond, marzipan, labre larver, high sweetness, toast, light acid notes, coconut cookies, armaretto. A bit too much - but it works somehow.

Bottle shared by Dasilky1 at RBWG 2011, thanks 
Appearance: Clear yellow with no head or lacing 
Aroma: Banana french toast with vanilla syrup 
Taste: Just like the name and aroma 
This was a great mead. I could have just sipped this one all night.

Bottle shared by Dasillky1, thanks man. Pours a bright yellow color with a thin coating of oily legs. The aroma, well....this is amazing; huge explosive bananas, nutmeg, vanilla, a rich cake. The flavor was very similar; massive bananas, spicy, hot and aggressive, vanilla, rich sweetness, a dessert for sure. Almonds, sugary sweet. One of the best noses ever.

Shared at RBWG by somebody who I need to give credit to!@ :(

Pours a flat golden color with no head. Aroma is banana french toast vanilla creme brulee vanilla wafers that made love with juicy cherries and ejaculates delicious cordial booze aromas into the nostrils. Flavor is much the same, but with a good but subtle ole kick of grandpas hard stuff in the finish. (his good stuff too, the one youre going to get in trouble for drinking). 

Best aroma ever, taste is great too. Best mead ive ever had!

7oz Bottle via Honuswagner. graci. The smell can be described in one word:  "Jesus".  well, heres a few more words for shits & gigs:  Marzipan, handmade by Jesus himself.  Lots of almond notes in the nose.  It sits in the glass a yellowish color and headless.  This is a sticky sweet concoction, but god damned is it good.  So retardedly dessertish...marzipan and banana, coupled with some pecan, and healthy dose of sex, love, and rock n roll.  Fuelish aftertaste of sweet sex, and of course, almonds.

Bottle shared by Dak.  Thank you sir!  Gold color pour with minimal head.  Aroma is brown sugar, maple syrup, bananas and spice.  Sweet flavor with all of the aroma notes included...and then some.  Crazy unique and delicious!
Nose of banana (though slightly fake), cinnamon, butter, bourbon, some maple. Huge nose. Light gold. Tastes remarkably like french toast. Very little alcohol warmth. Nice stuff, if a tad cloying.

[Bottle] shared by Tyler. Thanks! Pours clear with barely a hint of gold color and great legs. Aroma is concentrated almond extract, vanilla, banana extract, and I dont really get any bourbon. The flavor is not as concentrated as the aroma. Taste of maple syrup, almond, a hint of banana, and thats about it. Alcohol on the finish is warming but you dont really taste it because its so sweet.

Bottle thanks to Punkrkr27...Pours a light golden color, no head no carbonation...Crazy aroma! so much going on here. Very sweet, cherries, almonds, hazelnut, Irish cream coffee creamer...Very sweet flavor. Cant really pick out one flavor over another...sooooo tasty.

Holy shit! The aroma on this is sexy as hell! Bananas, almond crème, marzipan, some lighter cinnamon, and well fucking French toast! The alcohol is barely noticeable. Smells absolutely artificial, but its so goddamn aromatic. Pours thick, viscous and oily. Looks like a fat, buttery Cali Chardonnay in the glass. Flavor does not quite live up to the awesomeness of the aroma. Not nearly as syrupy sweet as the aroma suggests. There are flavors of almonds, bananas, a good dose of drying wood tannin, French toast batter. Fairly well attenuated all things considered. The alcohol is fairly prevalent, but not too overpowering. Fairly full bodied, syrupy and viscous but never becomes cloying. Fun, fun stuff. Thanks Jonathan!
Pours pale bright golden with no head. Huge nose and flavor of ammeretto, vanilla, banana. Smooth palate and finish. Legs flow down the glass like a 15% Chardonnay.

Nip bottle, courtesy of a friend. Thanks!! Pours a  deep, golden color; nice long legs; headless. This is hugely aromatic and generous in the glass: notes of almonds, amaretto, and a light dose of cinnamon; rich nuttiness, vanilla, and tons of oxidative qualities here; I cant tell whether some of these notes are well-handled oxidation or additions, but theyre hugely developed; part of one of the most unique and engaging aromas Ive enjoyed in some time; honestly, this mead was worth it just for the aroma (and Id be damn curious to know how they did this...). Hugely full mouthfeel, coating the palate; still; some warmth coming through, most definitely but nothing abrasive; the bourbon barrel comes through much more strongly in the mouth, paired with a hefty amount of alcohol thats well-integrated, certainly, but still quite prominent and more than Id prefer (it distracts a touch from some of the more subtle notes); beyond that, though, the alcohol subsides after the first few sips, and the same almond-y and amaretto-like notes play out beautifully here: lots of vanilla and nuttiness, certainly honey, and a light accompaniment of cinnamon; lightly spicy, hugely generous throughout, and (thankfully and somewhat surprisingly) never burdeningly sweet or cloying. Beautifully done, if just a touch overbearing in the mouth, for me (and I have a feeling that some folks sensitive to oxidation will have some negative reactions here). The finish is reasonably sweet, showing amaretto, almonds, and light spice.

Thanks to Dean for sharing. Fucking amazing. Arouma is artful. Cinnamon, maple syrup, super aroumatic. Each little sniff is like an exploration of a complex sugarscape...a perfect palate as well. Smooth and glasslike. savory fruits, honey nectar, sweet open flavors, continues with honey, and cinnamon. savory maple and honey notes. Finishes with a touch of warm alcohol. Best mead Ive ever had, by a long shot.

Huge thanks to daknole!! Bottle pours gold.  Aroma is sweet with banana bread, honey, caramel, and roasted pecans.  This is one of THE most unique things I have ever smelled.  Flavor doesnt quite live up to the smell but they definately named this one appropriately.  Im glad I had the opportunity to taste this.

Wow.  Bulldog04 is the man.  Yellow pour. Aroma is laden with bruleed bananas, honey, caramel, and honey.  Flavor is sweet with some banana, walnuts, caramel, maple, baklava.  One of the most uniqe beverages I have ever had the pleasure of tasting.

BottleRBSG 2010 This mead rocks! Clear golden mead with fantastic, centipede-like legs. I cannot put into words how good this smells, but its one of the best smelling things ever. I would like to have a Yankee Candle that smells like this. Well, I guess Ill give it a shot: Im picking up a medley of Amaretto, deep fried banana/cinnamon bread, vanilla, pralines and all other things rich, decadent and sweet. Full-bodied and oily with no carbonation. The alcohol is nearly transparent - doesnt taste like its over 7% ABV. The flavor is nearly as pleasurable as the aroma  buttery fried toast, vanilla and a wealth of hearty, dark, tropical blossoms honey. The finish is simply a continuation and then slow fade of the plush, luxuriant flavor. World class mead!

courtesy of bulldogp04, thanks man! wow. this is amazing. next to utopias i favor this just slightly fotr a better drinker due to apparent abv. this stuff is sooooo smooth, and tastes like a very unique, delicious candy. truly world class. i had this over 2 day, first with a bananas fost frech toast for breakfast, and the next evening next to utopias and several other fine spirits. this stuff has huge cinnamon, banana, bourbon, nutmeg, cake batter, and so many other tastes going on! again; wow. this is amazing.

Bottle labeled Bourbon Barrel BFTM.  Pours a thick golden straw.  Nose has honey, tropical fruits and faint notes of bourbon and oak.  Delicious stuff.  Lots of flowery honey, sweet fruits, maple, caramel, earthy spices and again just a hint of whiskey and wood.  Thick, creamy body has a lasting finish of dry honey wine, bourbon and oak.  Quite refreshing and easy to drink considering complexity.  Should age quite well.  Thanks Steve!

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2010 6oz nip bottle from dean. Thank u sir... Pours a mostly transparent honey pale yellow hue, forever still, lovely legs but seems a tad bit thinner than the rest for some reason or another... Huge intense bursting arom of honeycomb cinammon and pure maple syrup. Lovely and assertive. Smell this for a long time... Flavors are so in par with the aroma that is disgustingly consistent. Sweet desserty honeycomb, vaniilla, maple, cinammon. What the heck isnt in this that isnt solid? Smooth, sweet, terribly drinkable in small doses or maybe even huge quantities.

From a bottle. To call this anything short of mindblowing would be a sin. Ive never smelled anything so rich and perfectly crafted. Perhaps it seems an easy out as both a brewer and a drinker to make and drink dessert stuff like this, but the execution here is so dead on that proper respect must be paid. Id heard this was good, but it was impossible to be prepared for the utter richness that you will find in the aroma of this mead. A full on blast of maple, macadamia nut, amaretto, and tons of marzipan and maraschino are pure delight, like burying your nose in the richest, most lovely sweet breakfast. The flavor is more subtle, refined, actually possessing solid mead notes to go along with the sweetness and marzipan. Cinnamon and sugar galore. This is a masterpiece.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Big thanks to Dean for sharing this. Pours a clear honey yellow gold with no head. Aroma is sweet with cinnamon, banana, syrup and of course some honey. Flavor is similar with sweet banana and honey in the start with cinnamon and syrup notes growing towards the finish. This is a pretty crazy mead!

Extended cheers to Greg, Tpd975 for sharing this bottle. Just the though of this mead is phenomenal. 
thick honey coating all over the glass.
huge cinnamon nose, vanilla and barrel along with banana, floral honey blossom.
The rest is hugely enhanced by the experience of drinking this mead that is phenomenal. You could literally sit here for hours marveling at the nose of this beverage.
Palate is sticky with nice honey presence, banana along with some caramel; honey sugar.
Its sweet, boozy, loaded with barrel greatness, definitely get a lot of honey, lots of cinnamon and vanilla. Not sure what they use, either extract or not but I could spend hours sipping on a glass.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2012 Huge thanks to Vigo and Jale for picking these up for me and bringing them to DLD.

A:  Pours a nice light honey yellow, very thick, almost syrup like.

S:  Aromas of honey laden bananas foster.  Strong almond notes with hints of cinnamon and vanilla.

T:  Wonderful and sweet.  Dessert in a bottle.  Banana and cinnamon lead the way.  Notes of almond and honey sweetness.  Vanilla is there, a bit doughy, very much true to its name.

M:  Medium, still, sweet awesome.  I love this thing.  I am a bit sad that I just popped my last bottle.

Wow !! What an amazing combination of flavors. Cinnamon, nutmeg, maple syrup, bananas, and just the right amount of bourbon presence. Good mouthfeel. Sweet as to be expected, but not cloying in any way. Really does taste like you had some great banana French toast with a touch of bourbon-infused maple syrup. Incredible mead !

Pale yellow pour with no head.  The aroma is immense vanilla, cinnamon, french toast, ripe banana and floral clover honey.  The flavor follows through from the aroma but is slightly less sweet than the aroma with pronounced clover, wildflowers and fresh banana.  The body is sticky and smooth with a solid alcohol warming on the finish.Earlier Rating: 3/27/2010 Total Score: 4.4Clear, yellow-gold color, no head, and some legs after swirling.  Intense, ripe banana aroma with hints of cinnamon, honey, pecans, toasty caramel, vanilla extract, and a hint of bourbon on the finish.  Then flavor is bourbon, fusel alcohol, and vanilla upfront with a wave of banana, toasted pecans, and cinnamon in the middle and finishing wit some clover honey and light fruit.  Sticky viscous body with an alcohol kick.

Bottle at DLD 2k10.  Took me awhile to read my own hand-writing on this one, but I do remember drinking this and really liking it...  Pours to a pale golden body with a wisp of white head.  The aroma is super sweet vanilla and maple syrup.  The flavor is much the same but more intensely concentrated.  There is sweet maple syrup and powdered sugar.  Bready.  The palate is thick and medium bodied.  Near syrup texture.  I see why this mead is called French toast!

Pours a pale yellow, straw, nice with faint haze, no head. Aromas are a nice malty sweetness, honey and maple syrup, cinnamon, batter sweetness with banana and some mellow oak and bourbon. Nice, fairly intense. Initial is a nice sweeter edged mead, nice honey and syrup, the spice sticks to the back of the palate with cinnamon. Vanilla, batter, maple, butter, banana. Interesting, really fills the palate. My favorite mead from the brewery and the best that is true to its name.
